conclusion: Analyze the motion of the ball in both horizontal and vertical directions.
The semicylinder has a radius R = 0.75 m and the angle between OC and the horizontal direction is 53°.
Determine the coordinates of point C using trigonometry: x_C = 0.45 m, y_C = 0.60 m.
The ball is thrown horizontally from point B directly above point A.
The horizontal distance from B to C is x_C = 0.45 m.
The vertical distance from B to C is y_C = 0.60 m.
Use the equations of motion for horizontal and vertical motion.
Relate the horizontal distance: 0.45 = v_0 t.
Relate the vertical distance: 0.60 = 5 t^2, t^2 = 0.12, t = sqrt(0.12) ≈ 0.346 s.
Verify the horizontal velocity: v_0 = 0.45 / 0.346 ≈ 1.30 m/s.
The time taken for the small ball to move from point B to point C is approximately 0.346 seconds.
